data.title: Rebecca L. Braungart Celebrated for Dedication to the Field of Educational Technology
data.meta_description: Mrs. Braungart channels years of varied expertise into her work with Nardin Academy
data.text:
BUFFALO, NY, August 19, 2022 /24-7PressRelease/ -- Rebecca L. Braungart has been included in Marquis Who's Who. As in all Marquis Who's Who biographical volumes, individuals profiled are selected on the basis of current reference value. Factors such as position, noteworthy accomplishments, visibility, and prominence in a field are all taken into account during the selection process.

After serving as an English teacher for second through 10th grade students for many years, Mrs. Braungart decided to pursue higher education. Due to her natural inclination toward technology, she earned a Master of Science in educational technology and digital media from Canisius College in 2018. Supported by her education, which opened new opportunities within the field, she joined Nardin Academy, where she excels today, in dual directorial and teaching positions.

In her work as director of innovation and educational technology and as a high school computer science teacher with Nardin Academy, Mrs. Braungart helps kindergarten through 12th grade teachers create interesting active learning models for their classes. A certified teacher through the International Society of Technology Educators, she is also affiliated with the Western New York chapter of the Computer Science Teachers Association, where she serves as a K-16 liaison.

In a career filled with highlights, Mrs. Braungart is most proud of transforming Nardin Academy's traditional school library into a space that provides multiple learning outlets for children ages five through 18. By incorporating technology, she makes learning both interesting and effective. Looking toward the future, Mrs. Braungart aims to bring in more community partners and provide students with real-life applications regarding what they are currently learning in school.

About Marquis Who's Who®

Since 1899, when A. N. Marquis printed the First Edition of Who's Who in America®, Marquis Who's Who® has chronicled the lives of the most accomplished individuals and innovators from every significant field of endeavor, including politics, business, medicine, law, education, art, religion and entertainment. Today, Who's Who in America® remains an essential biographical source for thousands of researchers, journalists, librarians and executive search firms around the world. Marquis® now publishes many Who's Who titles, including Who's Who in America®, Who's Who in the World®, Who's Who in American Law®, Who's Who in Medicine and Healthcare®, Who's Who in Science and Engineering®, and Who's Who in Asia®. Marquis® publications may be visited at the official Marquis Who's Who® website at www.marquiswhoswho.com.
